required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Effectiveness of Resorbable Collagen Membrane - MatrixflexTM
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Effectiveness of Resorbable Collagen Membrane - MatrixflexTM for the Treatment of Periodontal Intrabony Defects

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, single blind, parallel-arm, multi-center, non-inferior clinical trial. 174 patients are recruited in total, and they are treated by Guided Tissue Regeneration (GTR). The patients are split in to two groups evenly: 87 in the experimental group and 87 in the control group.

primary_outcome.measure: The change of CAL at 12 weeks after surgery
The change of CAL at 24 weeks after surgery
The change of PD at 12 weeks after surgery
The change of PD at 24 weeks after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: The ratio between Baseline and gingival recession (GR) at 12 weeks after surgery.
The ratio between Baseline and gingival recession (GR) at 24 weeks after surgery.

arm_group.description: Experimental arm using the Matrixflex Resorbable Collagen Membrane for treatment of periodontal intrabony defects
Control arm using the Comparator Xenograft Resorbable Collagen Membrane or treatment of periodontal intrabony defects

intervention.description: Use of resorbable collagen membrane to treat periodontal intrabony defects.

facility.name: Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital, Shanghai Jiaotong University School of Medicine
